Excellent movie, it really makes you think about the conditions of prisoners and how they are treated. That's the surface level feeling I got, but the message of hope, even in the most dire of circumstances, is done very well here. Andy is one of the most likeable characters in any movie, and Red is right up there with him. Brooks' story is very tragic, yet realistic concerning those who have lived in prison for lengthy periods. This is a very solid film, and while some of it was hard to watch, it is definitely enjoyable and one of my new favorites

Um filme sobre liberdade, esperança e tudo o que nos mantém vivos, mesmo quando o mundo nos fecha as portas. Andy usou o pagamento dos polícias pelos seus serviços para conseguir cervejas para os colegas. Ele já nem bebia, mas satisfazia-o vê-los a saborear algo que os fazia sentir humanos, livres por um instante. Brooks preferiu tentar matar um companheiro do que sair em liberdade condicional. Ali, dentro da prisão, era respeitado, considerado culto e sábio. Cá fora, não sabia…

An undoubtedly perfect film, the definitely feels like a rewatch would be necessary to appreciate it to the fullest. Muito bom O começo do filme é muito bom, realmente senti na minha pele a angústia e a tristeza do personagem ao entrar na prisão, aprisionado em um ambiente hostil em que ele passaria o resto de sua vida lá, o filme fez muito bem em gerar empatia e preocupação pelos personagens. O meio do filme é bom, mas não me cativou tanto. Tem cenas importantes , emocionantes e legais... mas no geral não me prendeu tanto. O final é simplesmente lindo, a cena da fuga do personagem foi incrível, seu amigo se libertando e o encontrando depois foi realmente muito emocionante. Ótimo filme

Yeah… it’s good. Really good, even. But the whole “greatest film ever made” reputation it’s developed is a bit much, to be honest. It’s got brilliant performances, a powerful story, and that classic sense of hope-against-the-odds. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are flawless. But once you know where it’s going, it doesn’t really beg for a rewatch. It’s one of those films that hits hardest the first time and after that, it loses some of the magic. Still, no denying it’s a quality piece of cinema. Just maybe not the be-all and end-all people say it is.

At its core, The Shawshank Redemption is a meditation on hope—how it survives in the bleakest of places, and how it can become both a lifeline and a burden. Andy Dufresne embodies quiet, unwavering hope. He’s falsely imprisoned, stripped of everything, yet refuses to let Shawshank prison steal his inner light. Red, on the other hand, starts as a man who’s given up on hope. “Hope is a dangerous thing,” he says, “Hope can drive a man insane.” By the…

Possibly the greatest movie ever made. Tim Robbins has a great performance as an innocent man trapped in a situation not meant for someone like him. However, he still perseveres and uses his time in prison to help the other convicts around him. Morgan Freeman does a terrific job playing a guilty, yet likable character. The movie does a wonderful job humanizing all of the inmates, displaying very harsh realities, such as prison rape, false imprisonment, abuse from the guards in power to the helpless prisoners, and the complexities of the world seen by incarcerated people. Absolutely fantastic movie about hope and the desire for freedom.

The Shawshank Redemption is a deeply moving story about hope, resilience, and quiet rebellion set within the harsh confines of a prison. It follows Andy Dufresne, a banker wrongly convicted of murder, as he navigates life behind bars and slowly builds an unlikely friendship with fellow inmate Red. The pacing is slow but purposeful, letting the emotional weight build naturally. Tim Robbins delivers a subtle, steady performance as Andy, while Morgan Freeman’s narration and presence give the film its soul—calm,…

Todos os livros do Stephen King que viram filmes, eu vou atrás de assistir, não foi diferente de um sonho de liberdade, esse filme é simplesmente uma aula sobre esperança, resistência e amizade. Fiquei com o coração apertado e ao mesmo tempo cheio. A relação do Andy com o Red é daquelas que aquecem a alma, e o final… nossa, que final. This film is often hailed as one of the greatest of all time, but frankly, it feels overrated. The plot unfolds predictably, with few surprises, and the cinematography, while competent, offers nothing groundbreaking. Admittedly, the writing is exceptional—tight, eloquent, and emotionally resonant—and the film’s message of hope and resilience carries undeniable weight. Still, it's hard to see how The Shawshank Redemption has earned such near-universal acclaim. What exactly elevates it above so many other well-crafted dramas? Someone convince me. Willing to elaborate.

Una obra magistral imperecedera traída de la mano de Frank Darabont, director que más tarde también nos complacería con otra sobresaliente adaptación del orden de Stephen King, la Milla Verde. Tim Robbins y Morgan Freeman logran establecer en las dos horas de película una conexión muy real entre sus personajes, apoyados del elenco de personajes secundarios que, con solo un par de frases, se ganan el afecto del espectador (dejando un hueco especial en mi corazón para el viejo Brooks y Jake).

Hope. That’s what The Shawshank Redemption is all about. A story so gripping, so deeply human, it stays with you long after the credits roll. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are pure magic together, and Frank Darabont’s direction is flawless. The pacing, the narration, the final payoff—every element builds toward one of the most satisfying endings in cinema history. It’s not just a prison story; it’s a story about the resilience of the human spirit. “Get busy living or get busy dying.” This film gets busy being perfect.

Andy Dufresne is a young and successful banker whose life changes drastically when he is convicted and sentenced to life imprisonment for the murder of his wife and her lover. Set in the 1940's, the film shows how Andy, with the help of his friend Red, the prison entrepreneur, turns out to be a most unconventional prisoner.

12.02.2025 Bu filmi daha önce izlemediğime gerçekten inanamıyorum. Sinema kültürüm pek yoktur ama bu film beni derinden etkiledi. En çok da "umut" kavramı üzerine düşünmeme neden oldu. Film, Andy Dufresne’in, karısını ve onun sevgilisi olan golfçüyü öldürmekle suçlanıp mahkemeye çıkarılmasıyla başlıyor. İzlerken ben de onun gerçekten intikam almak için bu cinayetleri işlediğini düşündüm. Ancak zamanla, Andy’nin masumiyetine dair ipuçları ortaya çıkıyor. Andy hapishaneye gönderildikten sonra, gardiyanların gücü kötüye kullandıklarını ve mahkumlara insanlık dışı davrandıklarını görüyoruz. Böyle bir ortamda bile Andy,…

“Hope is a good thing — maybe the best of things.” Frank Darabont’s The Shawshank Redemption is not only a triumph of storytelling — it is one of the most emotionally resonant films ever made. Quiet in its delivery but monumental in its impact, it is a film about endurance, dignity, friendship, and the indomitable power of hope in the face of injustice and despair. Based on Stephen King’s novella Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption, the film centers on Andy…

Basada en la novela del gran Stephen King, esta película tiene un guión increíble y la adaptación es sublime, contiene cada detalle a la perfección. El dúo de Morgan Freeman y Tim Robbins hace que te metas en el papel de lleno y disfrutes de una de las mejores películas de la industria cinematográfica.

Les Évadés (The Shawshank Redemption, 1994), réalisé par Frank Darabont, est une adaptation du roman de Stephen King. Le film raconte l'histoire de Andy Dufresne (interprété par Tim Robbins), un banquier condamné à tort pour le meurtre de sa femme et de son amant, qui se lie d'amitié avec Red (interprété par Morgan Freeman), un détenu vétéran de la prison de Shawshank. Ensemble, ils traversent des années de captivité, d'injustices et de défis personnels, dans une quête de rédemption et…

Whilst viewing this film, it felt as though I went through the five stages of grief multiple times. Anger, confusion, acceptance to anger again. I appreciate how this film revealed how every prisoner, guilty or not guilty, has had a life to share. It amazes me how although the prison was in horrible condition, everyone benefited from each-other. Sharing ideas, knowledge, facts and ways of life. Although I wish the prisoners were not as constitutionalised as they were, especially to the point of death, I appreciate the empathy they awoke in me. Wish I had the same resilience as this finance bro.

（有雷） 這部電影讓我感受到了真正的活著，大口呼吸著新鮮空氣的感受。劇情結構完整，伏筆也收得很好。雖說經歷了幾十年，但這部能成為經典感動世人也確實名副其實。 撇除劇情，表演非常傳神。囚犯、獄警之間的微妙關係很出彩，也將牢獄生態刻畫的很細膩。不再只是上課、自由活動放風等，而是透由啤酒、圖書館、一首歌，很貼切地表達出什麼叫做真正的「自由之感」。假釋出去不叫自由，唯有享受此時此刻，感受到真正的活著，才叫自由。電影主旨很大一部分都在探討這個核心問題，無論透由攝影、配樂、節奏⋯，都把這點抓的很緊，也難怪這部電影能如此深入人心。 美好的事物永不消逝，要心存希望的活著。電影中以Red娓娓道來的方式講述他看見的Andy（也正是如此，關鍵逃獄的伏筆收回時才能如此震撼），帶出Andy是如何救贖著Red，讓他在假釋出獄後沒有做出另一種選擇。那顆的攝影很有意思，先是從櫥窗櫃帶到裏頭一排排的槍枝商品，最後將視覺焦點對準在指南針上。片名也取得很棒，開頭在宣判Andy終身監禁後，帶出了Red假釋渴望下次次失敗，對未來心灰意冷的狀態。經歷了20、30、40年三次假釋的盤問，他最後一次的回應非常有意思，也再次應證了摩根費里曼的演技真的名不虛傳。也必須稱讚片尾關於red的選擇，不用直白的語言敘述，而是以一顆鏡頭、兩個物品（槍枝/指南針）帶出了他正在經歷的思考，andy過去和他許下去樹下找石頭的承諾在此時變得至關重要！ 雖說以五分來評，我可能落在4.6左右，很感人很溫暖，但好像有點太完美了。可是它讓我知道劇本寫得極好，故事核心極棒，那不需要什麼頂級特效或設計，它接回自己發光！很喜歡這部電影，希望我日後拍出的作品也如此溫暖人心～

In a place where time stands still and despair looms heavy, the movie whispers that hope is a quiet, stubborn thing—it doesn’t scream, but it survives. Andy Dufresne is more than just a prisoner; he is a symbol of silent rebellion, of grace beneath pressure, and the belief that freedom begins in the heart. With its tender storytelling and soulful performances, this movie doesn’t just tell a story—it leaves a lingering echo in the soul.

SHAWSHANK, DONDE EL TIEMPO Y LA ESPERANZA RESISTEN. The Shawshank Redemption sigue la historia de Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), un banquero condenado a cadena perpetua por el asesinato de su esposa y su amante, un crimen que siempre asegura no haber cometido. Dentro de la prisión de Shawshank, Andy entabla una amistad con Red (Morgan Freeman), un recluso veterano que sabe cómo moverse dentro del sistema penitenciario. A lo largo de los años, Andy se enfrenta a la brutalidad carcelaria,…
No sé por qué tardé tanto en verla. De verdad me encantan este tipo de películas. ¿Por qué ya no hacen películas como esta? 😮‍💨🚬

“Get busy livin, or get busy dying.” Andy is falsely convicted of the murder of his wife (he’s set up), and must serve a life sentence at Shawshank prison. Red, played by Morgan freeman…

"The Shawshank Redemption," directed by Frank Darabont and based on Stephen King's novella "Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption," is a profound exploration of the human spirit's resilience in the face of institutional dehumanization. The film's narrative, centered around the unjustly imprisoned banker Andy Dufresne, offers a scathing critique of the prison system while simultaneously delivering a message of hope and redemption. The prison in "The Shawshank Redemption" is not a place of rehabilitation but a system designed to dehumanize and…

An amazing thought provoking masterpiece that makes the viewer pass all different emotions where prisoners are humanised, corruption exposed and justice brought to those worthy. Its a movie that makes you wonder and question what justice is and what's fair or not and what makes a life worth living even in the most hopeless scenario people live searching for that hope. One of the best movies that I have seen in my entire life. It is very inspirational, and manages to balance the bleakness of prison with the hope of redemption. One of the most compelling themes in this movie is the power of hope. The protagonist, Andy Dufresne, portrayed masterfully by Tim Robbins, embodies this theme as he navigates the harsh realities of Shawshank Prison. Throughout his incarceration, Andy’s unwavering belief in the possibility of freedom serves as a beacon of hope, not only for himself but also for his fellow inmates. So long story short watch this movie

It seems that Andy, too, loses hope throughout the film—he appears to come to terms with his fate, making prison a comfortable place for himself. But after the death of Tommy, his “student,” and his long stay in solitary confinement, something changes. Instead of accepting his fate and trying to make the best…

Some films don’t just unfold—they tunnel. Quietly, persistently, they chip away at the mortar between your ribs until their light floods in, irreversible. *The Shawshank Redemption* is a pickaxe wrapped in celluloid. Darabont crafts each frame like Andy carving chess pieces: patient, precise, turning confinement into art. The prison isn’t just a setting; it’s a character, breathing limestone dust and rot, yet Freeman’s voiceover hums like a harmonica in the dark—a reminder that walls can’t mute soul. What mesmerizes isn’t…

Writer-director Frank Darabont essentially turned Stephen King's novella, Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption , into a prison hangout movie. And historically, I do not love hangout movies, but…

A timeless masterpiece about hope, friendship, and resilience. Frank Darabont’s direction is impeccable, crafting a narrative that’s both emotionally powerful and deeply human. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman deliver career-defining performances, with their bond at the film’s heart offering moments of true emotional weight. The story unfolds with a perfect mix of drama, tension, and hope, leading to one of the most satisfying, cathartic conclusions in cinematic history. It’s a film that not only stays with you but becomes a part of you. Simply put: perfect.

While the story is particularly slow at parts, I didn’t find myself bored at all. In fact, even the slower scenes kept me on my toes, wondering what happens next. The buildup of Andy’s character makes you believe he’s just a quiet yet smart guy who’s just serving his time. But this persona he builds for himself is exactly how he manages to trick everyone in prison. And eventually, even outsmart the warden in a mind game of chess .

The Shawshank Redemption has a calm and serious vibe that really draws you into the characters' lives. While most of the film is set in a prison, it’s not solely focused on prison life; it’s really about hope, patience, and the bonds of friendship. The plot centers around a guy named Andy who ends up in jail for a crime he didn’t commit. Despite the grim situation, he remains composed, clever, and optimistic. He forms a friendship with another inmate,…

A deeply moving and beautifully crafted film about hope, resilience, and the human spirit. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman deliver outstanding performances, with chemistry that gives the story its emotional core. The pacing, narration, and quiet strength of the storytelling make it timeless. More than just a prison drama, it’s a powerful reminder that even in the darkest places, hope can be a lifeline. A true cinematic gem that only gets better with each rewatch.

Based on a novella by Stephen King, "The Shawshank Redemption (1994)" tells the powerful story of Andy Dufresne, a quiet banker sentenced to life in prison for a crime he didn’t commit. Inside the walls of Shawshank Prison, Andy befriends Red, a long-term inmate, and together they navigate the harsh realities of prison life. What unfolds is a deeply human tale about hope, friendship, and the unbreakable strength of the spirit even in the darkest places. This is hands down…

The Godfather is literally 500 Million times better than this mediocre basic film. I only give it three stars because of the acting performances. Maybe if Time Warner (Which was WarnerMedia, but now Warner Bros. It’s very refreshing to watch a film like this in 2025, with strong philosophical and central themes that trend more modern than post-modern. There’s strong critique without overwhelming irony, and the film concludes with a sense of general “feel good,” despite the more grizzly themes especially at the beginning. Despite hardship, hope ultimately wins, and while the moment of escape is the payoff for both Andy and the viewer, the greater victory was less about the moment of escape and…

For me The Shawshank Redemption isn’t just a movie, it’s an experience. Every frame, every line, every silence carries weight. It’s a masterclass in storytelling, character development, and emotional depth. The journey of Andy and Red is more than inspiring — it’s transformative. That final scene? Gave me chills and a kind of hope I didn't know I needed. A perfect film. 5/5. I wish I could erase my memory just to feel it all over again

A perfect story, told perfectly.  I never thought, “that’s stupid” or “That doesn’t make sense”.  A more idealized presentation of prison life obviously, where the core group of prisoners form a long and lasting friendship, and where the guards are grey in morality.   A beautiful score by Newman.   Darabont’s adaptation made me care for the characters.  I can see how he and this work were inspired by Frank Capra.  Nothing was extraneous and all brought home brilliantly.

The Shawshank Redemption is always a great watch. The development of the characters overtime and the interwoven plotting is great fun. On the other hand, some of the surprises are less enjoyable on the n-th watch. While the escape plan is great, it feels like a bit of a cheat to the audience that there are few bread crumbs for it. Also, the Elmo Batch reveal seems a bit too convenient. Maybe if it were a mini-series instead of a movie, they could have set it up better.

The Shawshank Redemption هو ببساطة قصيدة سينمائية عن الأمل. في وسط أسوار سجن لا يرحم، تظهر لنا القصة عن الصبر، والحرية، وعن ذلك الأمل الذي لا يموت مهما كانت الظروف. كل لحظة في هذا الفيلم مليئة بجمال بسيط وملهم. لا يتحدث عن الظلم فقط، بل عن كيفية تحويل هذا الظلم إلى قوة داخلية، وعن كيف يمكن لقطرة أمل أن تخلق محيطًا من التغيير. الفيلم يتركك مع شعور دافئ وعميق بأن الحياة تستحق كل لحظة، مهما كانت مليئة بالألم. إنه فيلم عن الخروج من الظلمات نحو النور، وعن معركة الإنسان الداخلية التي لا تنتهي ضد اليأس.

بصراحة حسّيت إني ما شفت بس فلم… حسّيت إني مريت برحلة عمر. فلم عظيم من كل النواحي، قصته تشد، تمثيله يصدّق، وكل لحظة فيه تحمل معنى عميق عن الأمل، والصبر، والحرية. خلاني أفكر كم مرة نحس إننا محبوسين بظروف، بواقع، بحياة ما نقدر نغيرها… بس هذا الفلم يعلّمك إن الإرادة والإيمان أقوى من أي جدار. النهاية؟ لحظة انتصار ما تنوصف… فلم يخلّي قلبك يبتسم بعد ما يضغطه بالحزن، ويذكّرك إن حتى في أقسى الأماكن، النور يلقى له طريق.

the film tells a powerful story of hope, friendship, and resilience against the backdrop of a harsh prison environment. Its themes resonate with many, making it relatable across generations. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman deliver outstanding performances that bring depth to their characters, making the emotional journey of the film impactful. It has received numerous awards and nominations, including seven Academy Award nominations. Its reputation continues to grow, often appearing at the top of various "greatest films" lists The direction by Frank Darabont and the cinematography contribute to its artistic merit. The film’s pacing and storytelling style are often praised

Undoubtedly one of the greatest movies ever made. The characters in this movie are some of the most human and layered in anything I’ve seen. Rewatching truly feels like checking up on old buddies. The way Frank Darabont is able to take convicts, one of the most disregarded groups of people in society, and he makes them feel just as real as anyone you’ve ever met. Fitting with its origins, this has the feeling of being a collection of novellas…

As of 5 April 2025, The Shawshank Redemption is the highest rated film on IMDb at a respectable 9.3/10 (the fact there are decimal places really means it’s a scale out of 100 which is pretty retarded of IMDb but I can imagine half the blokes “working” there can’t even count, also meaning they’ll never clock how little pussy they get). This film arguably lives up to this rating. Is it my favourite? No. Should other films be rated higher than this one? Yes. Does it qualify as one of the greats though? Absolutely. A strong 9/10 from me. Just watch and enjoy.

Une vrai critique du système carcérale américain et de ses dérives ! ☝️😔 Cela nous rappel à nous, française, français, des sombres moments de notre histoire, notamment avec notre très cher Dreyfus ! 🙏🙏 Le film en plus de compter une histoire memorable, nous fait le portrait d’une justice bâclé et corrompue ! Plus qu’un film cette capsule vidéo ludique frôle le documentaire par son soucis aux détails. Bien que l’histoire ici se finit bien pour le protagoniste, il ne faut pas se laisser distraire ! Wow. Entrancing. It’s like watching a lacemaker; each thread crosses and intertwines seemingly randomly or unintentionally purposefully, only to culminate in the display of a picturesque product in the end. Films where elements are treated as “throw away” world building components that merely shape characters and our perceptions, introduced with such nonchalance, only to be a part of something much more fantastic. Just wow. I was captivated from the start.  The vibe, genre, story, sweet sweet justice et. al. oh it was a delicious watch.

At its essence, it explores themes of hope, friendship, and the strength of the human spirit, all within the grim confines of Shawshank prison. The Shawshank Redemption is a masterpiece based on Stephen King's novella Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption . The film follows Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), a banker wrongly convicted of murdering his wife and her lover. Sentenced to life at Shawshank Prison, he forms an unlikely friendship with Ellis "Red" Redding (Morgan Freeman) while enduring the brutal realities of prison life.

It comes down a simple choice: Get busy living, or get busy dying. All I can say is THIS MOVIE IS SO GOOD. A masterclass in writing. The storytelling was so beautiful crafted. The execution just.. Gahhhhh! There are zero throw away scenes, everything had purpose and was tied together in such a calculated way. I couldn’t imagine being falsely accused and spending 20+ years suffering the consequences of a crime I didn’t commit. The weight you feel for Andy…

“I guess it comes down to a simple choice, really. Get busy living, or get busy dying.” I wish I could rate this higher. I might have to go back and lower all my other ratings to make up for it. The storytelling here was insane. I can’t believe how well-thought out this was. Every line was perfect. Every shot was perfect. The casting was perfect. I love that all the references were important and helped you dive deeper into…

Definitely a top 10 movie of all time for me 🙌 this film deserves six stars. holy smokes. “I have to remind myself that some birds aren't meant to be caged. Their feathers are just too bright. And when they fly away, the part of you that knows it was a sin to lock them up DOES rejoice. But still, the place you live in is that much more drab and empty that they're gone.”

Un monument incontournable du cinéma moderne qui justifie son aura par la profondeur des réflexions qu'il apporte et qui s'achève brillamment dans un dernier acte indéniablement marquant. Le rythme est certes lent mais l'enchainement cohérent des situations tient en haleine sans jamais être transcendant pour autant. On s'attache globalement à tous ces personnages bien qu'on regrettera l'aseptisation de certains segments (la torture des cellules d'isolement? tous les prisonniers sont gentils sauf un petit groupe d'homo?). Une copie aux allures de premier de la classe qui ne révolutionne pas le genre à mes yeux mais qui dispose de nombreuses qualités qui justifient son rang.

The Shawshank Redemption—the ultimate prison escape movie. The setup is so clever, the dialogue is sharp, and watching the friendship between Morgan Freeman’s character and Tim Robbins’ Andy develop is one of the best parts. The ending somehow manages to be both heartbreaking and uplifting, which is a rare balance to strike. There’s a reason this movie is considered one of the greatest of all time.

My First Cult Classic, What truly elevates 'The Shawshank Redemption' beyond a standard prison drama is its exploration of the human spirit's resilience. It's not just about surviving; it's about maintaining one's humanity in the face of dehumanizing circumstances. The film masterfully portrays how individuals can find strength in connection, in shared humanity, even within the most oppressive environment. The depiction of Shawshank itself is crucial. It's not merely a backdrop, but a character in its own right, a symbol…
